response_parsed.title: _pydecimal Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of the _pydecimal standard library module introduced in Python 3.12, focusing on its purpose, key features, and examples.
key_points: _pydecimal is a backward-compatible replacement for the deprecated decimal module.
It provides high precision arithmetic with guaranteed correct rounding according to IEEE 754 Rounding Modes.
The _PyDecimal class can represent numbers of arbitrary precision and maintain precision during calculations.
_pydecimal also offers support for context managers, allowing users to specify the desired rounding mode.

code_examples.code:
from _pydecimal import Decimal

# Instantiate a _PyDecimal object with high precision.
num1 = Decimal('12345678901234567890')

# Perform arithmetic operations on _PyDecimal objects.
num2 = num1 + Decimal('9876543210987654321')
print(num2)

from _pydecimal import getcontext

# Set the context for rounding mode.
getcontext().rounding = ROUND_HALF_DOWN

# Perform arithmetic operation within the specified context.
num1 = Decimal('0.5') + Decimal('0.1')
print(num1)

version_notes: _pydecimal is available in Python 3.12 and later.
The _PyDecimal class replaces the Decimal class from previous versions.
caveats: While _pydecimal provides high precision arithmetic, it may lead to slower performance compared to standard float operations due to the increased memory requirements of arbitrary-precision numbers.
